abstract: Many Nebraskan farmers are engaged in a deeply personal battle against Keystone XL Pipeline, fighting to protect heritage and land that has been passed down through several generations; vast majority of landowners along planned route have accepted terms with developer TransCanada, but roughly 12 percent that remain are planning to push back against eminent domain claims.
lead_paragraph: Several farmers in Nebraska are in a personal fight to protect land that in many cases has been passed down through generations.
snippet: Several farmers in Nebraska are in a personal fight to protect land that in many cases has been passed down through generations.

headline.main: Defenders of Tradition in Keystone Pipeline Fight
headline.print_headline: Defenders of Tradition in Keystone Pipeline Fight
